intro: Restio sphacelatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved restio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family, which is characteristic of the fynbos vegetation type. The plant is a perennial herb with slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in dense clusters. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native region. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
